did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Materials collected by Margaret M. Sullivan, a resident of Montgomery County, Virginia, including two photographs of students at Montgomery County's Sunnyside School.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Margaret M. Sullivan Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Margaret M. Sullivan Collection, Ms2013-091, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Margaret M. Sullivan Collection was donated to Special Collections in 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Margaret M. Sullivan Collection commenced and was completed in November, 2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret Sullivan was born September 5, 1926 to Myrtle and Benjamin Earl Mathena in the Toms Creek area of Montgomery County, Virginia. She spent her childhood living with her grandparents in a two-over-two log cabin that was built shortly after the Civil War and still (as of 2013) stands on Toms Creek. Margaret married Bernard Sullivan and had four sons and two daughters. She worked at the Radford Arsenal during World War II while Bernard served in the Army Air Corps. Later she worked in the lunchrooms at the Belleview and Prices Fork Elementary Schools. Margaret was a member of St. Mary's Catholic Church and the Prices Fork Grange. Margaret Sullivan passed away on January 20, 2013 after having lived in Prices Fork since the early 1950s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials collected by Margaret M. Sullivan, a resident of Montgomery County, Virginia. Included are two photographs of students at Sunnyside School in Montgomery County. The earlier photo, dated 1910, is a photocopy of a 1970s newspaper clipping and is accompanied by the names of those pictured; the pupils in the second photo, dated 1932, are unidentified. The collection also includes two handwritten pages of genealogical notes on the Price, Surface, and related families of Montgomery County, and a John F. Kennedy Vari-Vue presidential campaign button.

did.unittitle: Identification for 1910 Sunnyside School photograph, n.d.
